etymology.description: pictogram: war/ritual axe; later ‘soldier’ → ‘officer/intellectual’; related to 王, 圭, 金.
etymology.interpretation: Earliest forms depicted an axe, a symbol of martial power and authority, which naturally extended to mean a soldier and then an officer or learned gentleman. Connections to 王, 圭, and 金 reflect the ritual or jade/metal axe lineage in related graphs.

examples.chinese: 他是一名士兵(他是一名士兵)。
他是个绅士(他是個紳士)。
古代的士人重视礼仪(古代的士人重視禮儀)。
examples.english: In ancient times, scholar-gentry valued ritual propriety.
